title: Further Amendments to Executive Order 12835, Establishment of the National Economic Council

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates a previous order that established the National Economic Council by adding new members to the council. It expands the composition to include officials such as the Secretaries of Health and Human Services and Education, as well as various presidential advisors, to enhance interagency coordination on economic policy.
potential_concerns: Expanding the National Economic Council to include diverse agencies may slow decision-making, potentially delaying support for small-business-owners during economic crises.

Greater emphasis on energy and climate change within economic policy could shift resources away from fossil fuel sectors, negatively impacting some energy-sector-workers (oil, gas, coal) not directly represented in the council.

Enhanced interagency coordination might result in policy complexity that teachers-educators must navigate when federal education initiatives align with economic goals, causing implementation challenges.
Renewable-energy-workers may benefit from increased advocacy, but unintended neglect of traditional energy-worker transition plans could cause workforce displacement without adequate support.
